Tasks:
Image-Text Retrieval (cross-modal search).
Radiology Report Generation (automated diagnostic reporting).
Visual Question Answering (VQA) – both open-ended and closed-ended.

1. Recognition Tasks (basic perception): Ensure the VLM can identify abnormalities and distinguish pathologies: Organ recognition , Lesion recognition, Lesion counting (number of lesions in an organ/segment), Lesion type classification, Fatty liver recognition

2. Measurement Tasks (quantitative analysis): Evaluate precision in numerical quantification, crucial for diagnosis and staging: Organ volume measurement, HU (Hounsfield Unit) value measurement, Lesion volume measurement, Volume comparison

3. Visual Reasoning Tasks (spatial/structural reasoning): Test models’ ability to reason about spatial context in 3D anatomy.: Adjacency reasoning, Inter-segment comparison, Lesion distribution analysis

4. Medical Reasoning Tasks (clinical decision-making):  Assess higher-level diagnostic reasoning aligned with radiology practice: Tumor staging, Resectability assessment, Diagnosis-level reasoning

Image segmentation

Abnormality classification

Medical report generation

Visual Question Answering (VQA)
Notes: Evaluation code available for 2D images and not 3D
